qas.question: Why political movement was named for Joseph McCarthy?
What political theory did Eisenhower use to oppose McCarthy?
Who served as Eisenhower's vice president?
What sort of conservative was Eisenhower?

context: On the domestic front, he covertly opposed Joseph McCarthy and contributed to the end of <a0_0>McCarthyism<a0_0/> by openly invoking the modern expanded version of <a1_0>executive privilege<a1_0/>. He otherwise left most political activity to his Vice President, Richard <a2_0>Nixon<a2_0/>. He was a <a3_0>moderate<a3_0/> conservative who continued New Deal agencies and expanded Social Security. He also launched the Interstate Highway System, the <a4_0>Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency<a4_0/> (DARPA), the establishment of strong science education via the National Defense Education Act, and encouraged peaceful use of nuclear power via amendments to the Atomic Energy Act.
